conclusion: Analyze forces on block A for both configurations to determine frictional force at θ = 30°.
At θ = 37°, block A is on the verge of sliding.
Forces on block A: gravitational, normal, and frictional.
Components of gravitational force Mg: Mg sin θ (down slope), Mg cos θ (perpendicular).
For equilibrium, f equals gravitational component parallel to slope: f = 0.6Mg.
At θ = 30°, place smooth cylinder B with mass m between A and plane.
Cylinder B applies normal force on A but does not contribute to friction.
Gravitational force on A is Mg, angle changes to 30°.
Components of gravitational force Mg: parallel (0.5Mg), perpendicular (Mg cos 30°).
Substitute μ and N into f': f' = 0.75 × 2√3mg = (3√3/2)mg.
Frictional force of block A on slope at θ = 30° is (3√3/2)mg.
